docstr: `FLOOR` — Integer floor function ### Description `FLOOR(A)` returns the greatest integer less than or equal to `X`. ### Syntax `RESULT = FLOOR(A [, KIND])` ### Arguments . | `KIND` | (Optional) An `INTEGER` initialization expression indicating the kind parameter of the result. ### Return value The return value is of type `INTEGER(KIND)` if `KIND` is present and of default-kind `INTEGER` otherwise. ### Example ``` program test_floor     real :: x = 63.29     real :: y = -63.59     print *, floor(x) ! returns 63     print *, floor(y) ! returns -64 end program test_floor ``` ### Standard Fortran 95 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also CEILING, NINT
